plant_concentrations.References: (1) Rappe C; pp. 121-131 in Banbury Report 35: Biological Basis for Risk Assessment of Dioxin and Related Compounds. Plainview, NY: Cold Spring Harbor Lab Press (1991)
plant_concentrations.Value: Archived vegetation samples from the United Kingdom contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at 530, 460, 520, and 460 pg/kg for years 1891-1900, 1934-1944, 1960-1970, and 1979-1988, respectively(1).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) O'Keefe P et al; Chemosphere 13: 849-60 (1984) (2) Heida H, Olie K; Chemosphere 14: 919-24 (1985) (3) Nygren M et al; p. 17-34 in Chlorinated Dioxins and Dibenzofurans in Perspective, Rappe C et al eds, Lewis Publ (1986) (4) Ryan JJ et al; Chemosphere 15: 537-48 (1986) (5) Stalling DL et al; Chemosphere 14: 627-43 (1985) (6) Weismuller T, Schlatterer B; Chemosphere 38: 325-334 (1999) (7) Wiberg K et al; Chemosphere 24: 1431-39 (1992) (8) Elliott JE, Norstrom RJ; Environ Toxicol Chem 17: 1142-53 (1998) (9) Elliott JE et al; Environ Pollut 59: 91-114 (1989) (10) Hebert CE et al; Environ Sci Technol 28: 1268-77 (1994) (11) Nygren M et al; p. 17-34 in Chlorinated Dioxins and Dibenzofurans in Perspective, Rappe C et al eds, Lewis Publ (1986)
animal_concentrations.Value: 2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodibenzofuran levels of 13 to 79 parts per trillion were found in 19 ducks (black, mallard, wood) taken near the lower Hudson River in Catskill, NY in 1980(1). Concns of tetrachlorodibenzofuran (all isomers) found in the livers of mice and rabbits collected near a waste dump in Amsterdam, Netherlands were 0 to 13.8 and 0 to 0.168 ppb, respectively(2). 2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodiben zofuran concn of 12 pg/g was found in the fat of a seal taken from Finland in 1978(3). Levels of 6.0-330 pg/g were detected in the fat of 3 turtles collected from the St. Lawrence River near Lake Ontario in 1984 and 1985(4). Residue levels of <2.0 to 8 ng/kg were detected in fish-eating birds (herons, cormorants) from Green Bay and Lake Michigan in 1979-1982(5). Eels collected along the rivers Oder and Havel in 1996 contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at a mean concn of 0.25 pg/g fat (n=49)(6). Concns of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in composite samples of salmon muscle and osprey muscle were 31 and 3.8 parts per trillion, respectively(7). 2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodibenzofuran was present in the blood plasma of bald eagle chicks from the coast of British Columbia in 1993/1994 at concns of 0.11 to 4.5 ng/kg wet wt (n=51)(8). Great blue heron eggs from British Columbia collected in 1986 to 1987 contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 1 to 17 ng/kg, wet wt(9). Mean concns of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in herring gull eggs collected from 13 Great Lakes colonies from 1984 to 1991 ranged from 0.84 to 3.61 ng/kg wet wt(10). A 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran level of 63 pg/g was detected in an osprey egg collected in Sweden in 1981(11).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) Addison RF et al; Marine Environ Res 47: 225-240 (1999) (2) Berggrena P et al; Mar Pollut Bull 38: 1070-84 (1999) (3) Kumar KS et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 3448-55 (2001) (4) Kannan K et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 441-7 (2001) (5) Choi JW et al; Chemosphere 44: 1375-82 (2001) (6) Wu WZ et al; Ecotoxicol Environ Safety 46: 252-57 (2000) (7) Kannan K et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 38: 362-70 (2000) (8) Desolla SR et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 40: 410-17 (2001) (9) Marvin CH et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 19: 344-51 (2000) (10) Hashimoto S et al; Chemosphere 39: 2661-69 (1999)
animal_concentrations.Value: Grey seals sampled in February 1995 from Sable Island, Newfoundland, Canada, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns of 4.35 pg/g lipid (n=6) in maternal blubber, 2.66 pg/g lipid (n=6) in maternal milk, and 1.86 pg/g lipid (n=6) in pup blubber(1). The mean concns of 2,3,4,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran/2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in the blubber of immature male harbor porpoises from the Baltic sea (sampled between 1985-1993) and Katteregat-Skagerrak seas (sampled between 1989-1990) were 3.1 and 2.1 pg/g lipid wt, respectively(2). Blubber of mature male harbor porpoises from the Baltic sea (sampled between 1988-1989), Katteregat-Skagerrak seas (sampled between 1988-1990), Katteregat-Skagerrak seas (sampled between 1978-1981), and the west coast of Norway contained an avg of 9.4, 2.8, 3.9, and 3.2 pg/g lipid wt of 2,3,4,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran/2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran, respectively(2). At 4 locations in southern India, the concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in animal fat tissues were(3): chicken (<0.1 pg/g fat wt); lamb (1.4 pg/g fat wt); goat (0.2 pg/g fat wt), ganges dolphin (9.2 pg/g fat wt). For animal muscle tissues collected from 4 locations in southern India, the concns of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran were(3): eagle (2.1 pg/g fat wt); prairie kite (27 pg/g fat wt); osprey (64 pg/g fat wt); spotted owlet (12 pg/g fat wt). Double-crested cormorants and herring gulls from the Great Lakes (sampled in May 1998) had concns of 2,4,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran which ranged from 1.2 to 5.2 pg/g wet wt and 1.1 to 6 pg/g wet wt, respectively(4). The mean concn of 2,3,7,7-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in black-tailed gulles from Japan (Rishir Islands) was 1.4 pg/g lipid wt (range, 0.7-2.7 pg/g lipid wt) collect in June 1998(5). The concn of 2,3,78-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in the muscle and eggs of piscivorus birds were 0.87 and 0.92 ng/kg dry wt, respectively, from a heavily polluted lake in China(6). The muscle and liver tissues of yellow-blotched map turtles from Pascagoula river basin, Mississippi had 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran concns that ranged from <0.008 to 0.396 pg/g lipid wt and 0.02 to 0.169 pg/g lipid wt, respectively(7). The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in pooled snapping turtle eggs from Akwesasne, Mohawk territory, Ontario, Canada in 1998 was 6.66 ng/kg (recovery 75%)(8). Mussels (Dreissena) from Port Dalhousie in western Lake Ontario contained 7.9 pg/g dry tissue of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran(9). The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in invertebrates collected from Hiraiso, Japan were as follows(10): sea slug, 0.044 pg/g wet wt; sea urchin, 0.35 pg/g wet wt; starfish, 0.18 pg/g wet wt; mussel, 1.3 pg/g wet wt; snail, 0.070 pg/g wet wt.

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) O'Keefe P et al; Chemosphere 13: 849-60 (1984) (2) Nygren M et al; pp. 17-34 in Chlorinated Dioxins and Dibenzofurans in Perspective, Rappe C et al eds, Lewis Publ (1986) (3) Ryan JJ et al; pp. 87-97 in Chlorinated Dioxins Dibenzofurans Total Environ, Proc Symp 1982, Choudhry G et al eds, Boston, MA: Butterworth (1983) (4) Jimenez B et al; Chemosphere 32: 461-67 (1996) (5) De Vault D et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 8: 1013-22 (1989) (6) Braune B et al; Sci Total Environ 230: 145-207 (1999) (7) Giesy JP et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 36: 432-46 (1999) (8) Wu WZ et al; Ecotoxicol Environ Safety 46: 252-57 (2000) (9) Kumar KS et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 3448-55 (2001)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Striped bass collected from Atlantic coast waters in 1982-3 (RI, NY, MD) contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran levels of 5.6-78 parts per trillion(1). Levels of 62 and 3.9 pg/g were detected in salmon from Sweden collected in 1978 and herring from the Baltic Sea collected in 1981(2). 2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodibenzofuran was found to be a relatively common contaminant in Lake Ontario fish in 1980 at levels on the order of 10 parts per trillion(3). Fish oil capsules, taken as a dietary supplement in Spain, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at an avg concn of 5.50 pg/g (n=7)(4). 2,3,7,8-Tetrachlorodibenzofuran was measured in lake trout and walleye from several sites in the Great Lakes: Lake Superior (14.8 ng/kg wet wt; n=10), Lake Huron (22.8; n=5), Lake Michigan, Saugatuck (34.8; n=5), Lake Michigan, Sturgeon Bay (41.5; n=2), Lake Michigan, Kenosha (42.3; n=3), Lake Erie (11.3; n=5), Lake St. Clair (24.8; n=5), and Lake Ontario (18.5; n=5)(5). In fish from the Canadian Arctic, the concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran ranged from not detected (unspecified) to 28 pg/g wet wt(6). Coho salmon collected from Lakes Superior, Michigan, and Huron contained 6 to 19 ng/kg wet wt of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in the dorsal muscle(7). The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in muscle tissue of common carp taken from a heavily polluted lake in China was 2.36 ng/kg dry wt(8). The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in fish at four locations in southern India ranged from <0.1 to 16 pg/g fat wt(9).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Heida H, Olie K; Chemosphere 14: 919-24 (1985) (2) Schuhmacher M et al; Chemosphere 39: 419-29 (1999) (3) Jimenez B et al; Chemosphere 32: 1327-48 (1996) (4) Maystrenko V et al; Chemosphere 37: 1699-708 (1998) (5) Alcock RE et al; Environ Sci Technol 32: 1580-7 (1998) (6) Gaus C et al; Chemosphere 43:549-58 (2001) (7) Green NJL et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 1974-81 (2001) (8) Hoekstra EJ et al; Environ Sci Technol 33: 2543-9 (1999)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Top soil collected near a waste dump in Amsterdam, Netherlands was found to contain tetrachlorodibenzofuran (all isomers) levels of 1.4 to 23.9 ppb(1). Soils collected in the vicinity of a municipal solid waste incinerator from Tarragona (Catalonia, Spain) in 1996 and 1997 contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at 0.57 to 1.72 ng/kg dry matter (24 samples collected for each year)(2). Surface soil samples collected in the vicinity of a clinical waste incinerator contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 1.15 to 13.3 pg/g(3). Soil from industrial centers, farm regions, and natural reserves in the Republic of Bashkortostan, Russia, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at mean concns of 5.52, 0.07, and 0.04 parts per trillion, respectively(4). A previously unopened soil sample collected in 1881 from Rothamsted Experimental Station, England, 0 to 23 cm depth, and a soil sample collected in 1986 from the same field plot contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at 0.29 and 0.95 pg/g dry wt(5). Top soil from Queensland, Australia contained <0.013 to <0.29 pg/g dry wt of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran(6). Concns of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in soils from Rothamsted (UK) ranged from 0.11 to 1.54 pg/g between the years 1856 to 1913 and soils from Woburn Stackyard (UK) ranged between 0.02 to 0.58 pg/g between 1876 to 1938(7). At four sites in a rural area near Spenlderbos, Netherlands, the concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in Beach and a Douglas Fir forests ranged from 0.67 to 11 ug/kg dry wt and 0.20 to 7.4 ug/kg dry wt, respectively(8).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) O'Keefe P et al; Chemosphere 13: 849-60 (1984) (2) Hayward DG et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 30: 30-9 (1996) (3) Lu JR et al; Chemosphere 31: 2779-89 (1995) (4) de Wit, C et al; Chemosphere 20: 1473-80 (1990) (5) Vartiainen T et al; Chemosphere 34: 1341-50 (1997) (6) Beurskens JEM et al; Wat Sci Tech 29: 77-8 (1994) (7) Bopp RF et al; Environ Sci Technol 25: 951-6 (1991) (8) Evers EHG et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 12: 1583-98 (1993) (9) Gotz R et al; Chemosphere 27: 105-11 (1993)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: Sediment collected in Sept 1983 from the Hudson River near Albany, NY had a 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran concn of 5.0 parts per trillion while sediment from the Hudson River near NYC had concns of 29-46 parts per trillion(1). River sediment samples collected near the McCormick and Baxter wood treatment facility, Stockton, CA, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 0.3 to 10 ng/kg dry wt during March 1992 sampling(2). Sediment samples from fish culture ponds near waste incineration sites for metal reclamation in Wan-Li, Taiwan, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 0.002 to 0.919 ng/g dry wt(3). Sediment from a deep core collected in the Baltic Sea contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns of 0.8, 1.1, 1.8, 3.9, 16, and 13 pg/g dry wt for 26-28, 16-18, 8-10, 4-6, 2-4, and 0-2 cm, respectively (4). Lake bottom sediments (from depth of 1-2 cm) from Lake Pahtajarvi, Lake 222 and Lake Sierram, each are subarctic headwater lakes in Lapland, contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at 2.35, 0.57, 3.00 pg/g dry wt, respectively(5). Lake Ketelmeer sediment from 1945, 1965 and 1985 contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at 25, 170, and 35 ng/kg (6). Sediments and suspended matter samples collected from estuaries adjacent to an industrial site in Newark, NJ where chlorinated phenols had been produced contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from <32 to 4500 parts per trillion and 220 to 380 parts per trillion, respectively(7). Sediments (<63 um sediment fraction) collected from the western Wadden Sea, the middle Wadden Sea, Ems-Dollard, the Rhine, Wester Scheldt, the North Sea and the Humber contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 8 to 28, 8, 11, 12 to 29, 8, and 34 to 148 ng/kg dry wt, respectively(8). Six sediment sampling points along the River Elbe, Germany in 1989/1990 contained 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran at concns from 20 to 100 pg/g dry wt(9).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Bellucci LG et al; Mar Pollut Bull 38: 1070-84 (2000) (2) Gaus C et al; Chemosphere 43:  549-58 (2001) (3) Muller JF et al; Chemosphere 39: 1707-21 (1999) (4) Kannan K et al; Environ  Toxicol Chem 20: 1878-89 (2001) (5) Marvin CH et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 19: 344-51 (2000)  (6) Masunga S et al; Environ Sci Technol 35: 1967-73 (2001)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in surficial sediments from the Venice  lagoon (Italy) ranged from <0.010 to 1.602 ug/kg sampled between the period 1996 to 1998(1).  In sediments from Queensland, Australia, the concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran ranged  from <0.012 to <0.27 pg/g dry wt(2). At locations around Bisbane, Queensland, Australia, the  concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran in sediment (marine and freshwater) ranged from <1.4  to 120 pg/g TOC(3). The concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran ranged from 1.87 to 50.3 pg/g  dry wt in sediments from the Upper Detroit river and lower Rouge river (both in Michigan) in  1998(4). At Port Dalhousie, western Lake Ontario, the concn of 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran  in sediments with and without mussel (Dresissena) colonization were 7.4 and 5.2 pg/g dry  sediment, respectively(5). In a sediment core dating from the years 1947 to 1993, the concn of  2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzofuran ranged from 0.6 pg/g dry wt (in 1947) to 2.6 pg/g dry wt (in  1993)(6).
